</style>
</head><body><div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It's often the case where data scientists want to explore a data set that doesn't fit into memory.  As data continues to grow in size, so too, do our tools to work with these data need to expand.
Motivation for this post originates from my interest in working with <a href="https://opensnp.org/">openSNP</a> data. openSNP is an open-source platform where users upload their genotype data from direct-to-consumer genetics companies like <a href="https://www.23andme.com/">23andMe</a>.  Raw result files are often hundreds of thousandas of records long, each record representing a location in the human genome.  There are over 4,000 raw result files in the openSNP data however, my laptop runs a VirtualBox with only 5GB RAM, which meant I needed to find some clever solutions beyond the standard <a href="">pandas</a> library in order to work with this much data.  This post describes one of several applications that can benefit from out-of-core computing.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Download-the-openSNP-data">Download the openSNP data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Download-the-openSNP-data">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>openSNP has over 40 GB of genotype & phenotype data stored as text files!<br/>
For the purposes of this demo, the analysis will be limited to only the 23andMe files.  Below are a few shell commands to get the raw data, create a directory and extract 23andMe files.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span>%%sh
wget https://opensnp.org/data/zip/opensnp_datadump.current.zip
unzip opensnp_datadump.current.zip

<span class="c1"># Isolate the 23&me; files</span>
mkdir gt23
mv opensnp_datadump.current/*.23andme.txt* gt23/

<span class="c1"># how many 23&me; genotype files?</span>
find gt23/ -type f <span class="p">|</span> wc -l
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here's a look at an example 23andMe result file, the header is commented out with <code>#</code> then there are 600,000+ rows of genotype data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img alt="raw data" class="img-responsive" src="images/23andMe_raw.JPG"/></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Extract-a-reasonable-test-set">Extract a reasonable test set<a class="anchor-link" href="#Extract-a-reasonable-test-set">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>For this demo exercise, let's use a manageable subset of the full openSNP data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span>%%sh
mkdir gt23_testset
cp gt23/user21* gt23_testset/
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">glob</span>
<span class="n">allFiles</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">glob</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">glob</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"gt23_testset/*.txt"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span>%%sh
du -h gt23_testset/
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>766M	gt23_testset/
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Pure-pandas">Pure pandas<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pure-pandas">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>First, start with a pure <a href="http://pandas.pydata.org/">pandas</a> <code>read_csv</code> solution, something that should be familiar to Python data scientists.  Let's try to create a large <code>DataFrame</code> in memory.  <code>join</code> can accomplish this task, even though it's an expensive operation, the test data is small enough that we can successfully execute it.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">re</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
gtdf = pd.DataFrame(index=['rsid']) #empty DataFrame

for file_ in allFiles:
    #extract the userid
    match = re.search('user(\d+)', file_)
    userid = match.group(1)
    
    df = pd.read_csv(file_, 
                     comment='#', 
                     sep='\t', 
                     header=None,
                     usecols=[0,3],
                     error_bad_lines=False,
                     names=['rsid', userid],
                     dtype={'rsid':object,
                            'genotype':object},
                     index_col=['rsid']
                    )
    gtdf = gtdf.join(df, how='outer')
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 7min 48s, sys: 9.83 s, total: 7min 58s
Wall time: 8min 15s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">gtdf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[7]:</div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>

<th>i3000003</th>

<td>G</td>
<td>G</td>
<td>--</td>

<p>5 rows × 43 columns</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>On the test set of 43 files, the entire <code>DataFrame</code> fits into memory.
However, using this pure pandas method on the entire openSNP data set of 1,915 files would eventually 
crash the computer because it would run out of pyhsical memory.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Dask----parallel-out-of-core-DataFrame">Dask -- parallel out-of-core DataFrame<a class="anchor-link" href="#Dask----parallel-out-of-core-DataFrame">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Enter <a href="http://dask.pydata.org/en/latest/index.html">dask</a>, a parallel Python library that implements out-of-core DataFrames.  It's API is similar to pandas, with a few additional methods and arguments.  Dask creates a computation graph that will read the same files in parallel and create a "lazy" <code>DataFrame</code> that isn't executed until <code>comptue()</code> is explicitly called.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img alt="Dask Graph" class="img-responsive" src="http://dask.pydata.org/en/latest/_images/pipeline.png"/></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">dask.dataframe</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">dd</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span> 
# won't actually read the csv's yet...
# similar read_csv() as pandas
ddf = dd.read_csv('gt23_testset/*.txt',
                  comment='#', 
                  sep='\t', 
                  header=None,
                  usecols=[0,3],
                  error_bad_lines=False,
                  names=['rsid', 'genotype'],
                  dtype={'rsid':object,
                         'genotype':object})
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 112 ms, sys: 52 ms, total: 164 ms
Wall time: 298 ms
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Dask defaults to 1 partition per file</span>
<span class="n">ddf</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>dd.DataFrame<from-de..., npartitions="43"></from-de...,></pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
#  this operation is expensive
ddf = ddf.set_index('rsid')
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 4min 44s, sys: 23 s, total: 5min 7s
Wall time: 4min 45s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The dask <code>compute()</code> method provides familiar results.  Since we didn't <code>join</code> the dask DataFrame, let's investigate one record (or one SNP).
Remember, in contrast to <code>gtdf</code>, <code>ddf</code> isn't in memory so it will take longer to get this result.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
# dask DataFrame
ddf.loc['rs1333525']['genotype'].value_counts().compute()
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 3min 31s, sys: 36.1 s, total: 4min 7s
Wall time: 3min 46s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[12]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>CC    37
CT     5
TT     1
Name: genotype, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
# pure pandas DataFrame
gtdf.loc['rs1333525'].value_counts()
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 4.3 s, sys: 8.1 s, total: 12.4 s
Wall time: 1min 1s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>CC    37
CT     5
TT     1
Name: rs1333525, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>At first blush, the computation times are deceiving.  As expected, the dask method took longer because of the lazy computation, it still had to read all the files and then perform the operation.  However, when you consider the <strong>8 minutes 15 seconds</strong> required to join <code>gtdf</code> DataFrame from <em>cell 6</em> above in addtion to the <strong>1 minute 1 second</strong> for <code>gtdf.loc[rs13333525'].value_counts()</code>, that's <strong>9 minutes 16 seconds</strong>.  In contrast, the dask method required 3 steps.  First setting the computation graph (<em>cell 9</em>) was < 1 second.  So the real comparison comes from the <strong>4 minutes 45 seconds</strong> to set the index (<em>cell 10</em>) and <strong>3 minutes 46 seconds</strong> to perform <code>ddf.loc['rs1333525']['genotype'].value_counts().compute()</code> (<em>cell 12</em>) for a grand total of <strong>8 minutes 31 seconds</strong>. Seems like a marginal speedup on our test data of only 43 files.  The real power of <code>dask</code> comes into play when you can't fit the DataFrame into memory.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Increase-query-peformance----Convert-.txt/.csv-to--Parquet!">Increase query peformance -- Convert .txt/.csv to  Parquet!<a class="anchor-link" href="#Increase-query-peformance----Convert-.txt/.csv-to--Parquet!">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It would be nice to speed up the dask queries so we can work with the <code>DataFrame</code> for downstream analysis in a reasonable amount of time.
The solution is to store the raw text data on disk in an efficient binary format.  A popular choice for this is traditionally <a href="https://support.hdfgroup.org/HDF5/doc/H5.intro.html">HDF5</a>, but I chose to use <a href="https://parquet.apache.org/">parquet</a> becuase 
HDF5 can be tricky to work with.  Dask uses the <a href="http://fastparquet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html">fastparquet</a> implementation.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
dd.to_parquet('gt23test_pq/', ddf)
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 12min 35s, sys: 1min 41s, total: 14min 17s
Wall time: 19min 30s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Essentially, what we've done to this point is convert <code>.txt</code> files to parquet files.  How much performance is really gained from this? 
Revisiting the dask DataFrame, <code>ddf</code>, remember that took 3 minutes and 46 seconds to compute <code>value_counts()</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># using dask with fastparquet, lazy, so nothing computed here...</span>
<span class="n">pqdf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_parquet</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'gt23test_pq/'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'rsid'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
pqdf.loc['rs1333525']['genotype'].value_counts().compute()
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 8.18 s, sys: 608 ms, total: 8.79 s
Wall time: 11.7 s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>CC    37
CT     5
TT     1
Name: genotype, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Parquet offers a noticeable performance increase for querying data, even with this small validation set of 43 files.  Scaling this up to 1,915 files, the parallel <code>.txt</code> version, <code>ddf</code>, took 5+ hours to execute <code>value_counts()</code> for one SNP.
<code>to_parquet</code> on the 1,915 file <code>DataFrame</code> took a couple hours.  Once you see the query performance improvements, it's well worth the up-front cost of converting from <code>.txt</code> or <code>.csv</code> to parquet.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><img alt="query performance" class="img-responsive" src="images/dask-parquet-query.jpg"/></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Performance-on-the-entire-openSNP-data-set">Performance on the entire openSNP data set<a class="anchor-link" href="#Performance-on-the-entire-openSNP-data-set">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I pre-computed the parquet files for the entire <code>gt23</code> directory using the same commands above.  Some malformed files needed to be cleaned and/or removed.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span>%%sh
find gt23_pq/ -type f <span class="p">|</span> wc -l
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>1898
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">allpqdf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_parquet</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'gt23_pq/'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'rsid'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%%</span><span class="k">time</span>
allpqdf.loc['rs1333525']['genotype'].value_counts().compute()
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CPU times: user 6.67 s, sys: 112 ms, total: 6.78 s
Wall time: 7.2 s
</pre>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>CC    1625
CT     277
TT      13
Name: genotype, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>These results highlight the far superior performance of parquet over <code>.csv</code> or <code>.txt</code>.  Additionally, dask proved it's value as an easy-to-use tool when physical memory is a constraint.
By now you've probably noticed I wasn't able to assign the user identifier to each column.  <code>dd.read_csv()</code> assumes the column names in each file are identical.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Implemenation-on-the-entire-openSNP-dataset">Implemenation on the entire openSNP dataset<a class="anchor-link" href="#Implemenation-on-the-entire-openSNP-dataset">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The dask and parquet portion of the tutorial have concluded.  I wanted to show how easy dask and parquet make it to quickly compare variant frequencies in the openSNP data to <a href="http://exac.broadinstitute.org/">exAC</a> data.
Here we'll define a function to extract variant frequencies from exAC, then compare to openSNP frequencies.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">urllib.parse</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">urlparse</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">urllib.parse</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">urlencode</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">urllib.request</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">urlopen</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">json</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ExacFrequency</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rsid</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">exac</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>

        <span class="n">request</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">urlopen</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'http://exac.hms.harvard.edu/rest/dbsnp/</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rsid</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">request</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">decode</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'utf-8'</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">exac_variants</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loads</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">'variants_in_region'</span><span class="p">]</span>

        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">alt_json</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">exac_variants</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">exac_allele</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">alt_json</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ref'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">alt_json</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'alt'</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">exac_freq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">alt_json</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'allele_freq'</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">exac</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">exac_allele</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">exac_freq</span>
    <span class="k">except</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'n/a'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">}</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">exac</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">brca2snps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'rs766173'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rs144848'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rs11571746'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rs11571747'</span><span class="p">,</span>
             <span class="s1">'rs4987047'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rs11571833'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rs1801426'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'rsid'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gt'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'source'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'varFreq'</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">snp</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">brca2snps</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">Osnp_alleles</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">allpqdf</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">snp</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s1">'genotype'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">compute</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="c1">#dask</span>
    
    <span class="n">Osnp_alleles</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Osnp_alleles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_dict</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">opensnp_N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Osnp_alleles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span><span class="p">())</span>
    
    <span class="n">Osnp_freqs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="n">alt</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AC</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">opensnp_N</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">alt</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">AC</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">Osnp_alleles</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">()}</span>
    <span class="n">exac_freqs</span><span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ExacFrequency</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">snp</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">freq</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">exac_freqs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
        <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'rsid'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">snp</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gt'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'source'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'exAC'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'varFreq'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">freq</span> <span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span> <span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">freq</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">snp_freqs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">gt</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">exac_freqs</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">gt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gt</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">[::</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">exac_freqs</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">gt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">[::</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">continue</span>
        <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'rsid'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">snp</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'gt'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">gt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'source'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'Osnp'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'varFreq'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">freq</span> <span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span> <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">

<p>I hope you find this post useful and think about using dask and parquet when working with structured text files.  I really encourage you to check out the dask and parquet documentation and follow along on some of their tutorials.  Thanks for reading, comments and code improvements welcome!</p>
